archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Diary of Carrington Phelps, owner of the historic Phelps Tavern of Colebrook, Litchfield County, Connecticut, for the year 1931. In daily entries Phelps describes weather and activities like reading, milking, sawing timber. For excerpts, provided by the seller, see finding aid link below.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Carrrington Phelphs Diary, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 08/04/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and minimally processed in August 2009 by Ute Schechter.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carrington Phelps was the owner by inheritance the Phelps Tavern inLitchfield County, Connecticut. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Carrington Phelps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diary of Carrington Phelps, owner of the historic Phelps Tavern of Colebrook, Litchfield County, Connecticut, for the year 1931. In daily entries Phelps describes weather and activities like reading, milking, sawing timber. For excerpts, provided by the seller, see finding aid link below.
